title: Organisch
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Schriftzug1_4896.jpg)

From a Book-Cover 1948.  
It's about city planning in Germany / Bielefeld / Sennestadt  
The Scriptfont ist important for my actual project, and more complicated to find similar. I hope anybody has an idea?  
The second font, that occurs on the cover is a Serif Capital-Letter font. If anybody knows something similar. Thanks too ;) i#m just starting to search this font. baldur

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Schriftzug2_3657.jpg)
author: baldur

comments.content:
The script looks like handwritten/lettering to me (look at the lower connection point between /h & /e)  
Some alternatives you may like:  
 **[Elisa Linotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype&ffam=Elisa%20Linotype%20Regular%20-%20Regular&fid=8e64c04e2e1ec6d5aa2cdd2e384f034d&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=Organische&fit=1)**  
 **[Allura](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Google-Web-Fonts&ffam=Allura%20-%20Regular&fid=c7fdb3ed6f5d1b76c7defaae70bda2b3&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=Organische&fit=1)**  
 **[P22 Corinthia](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=P22&ffam=P22%20Corinthia%20-%20Regular&fid=3eaed38d0ec2784e5f44551d10cba7ee&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=Organische&fit=1)**  
 **[Mr De Haviland](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Google-Web-Fonts&ffam=Mr%20De%20Haviland%20-%20Regular&fid=82632e9702d8d46d43ec79807206a132&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=Organische&fit=1)**

similar to your serif:  
 **[City](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Berthold&ffam=City%20-%20Medium&fid=8cf2570485378f76c73edb58cdae8130&fsize=60&text=BAUKUNST&fit=1)** by Berthold.  
Serifs are different on many letters. The light version plus some manual compression could probably be closer to your sample.

Some alternatives I like for the first one: [Castro Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/castro-script), [Business Penmanship](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/business-penmanship), [Mina](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/resistenza/mina), [Prelude](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.ffonts.net/PreludeFLF-Italic.font), [Dune](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hallmark/dune), [Learning Curve](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/Learning-Curve-Pro), [Matinee Idol](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/matinee-idol), [Mocha Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/mochascript.php), [Notera](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/notera), [Signerica](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/signerica), [Handsome](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/handsome), [Tesla](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.tipometar.org/kolumne/TeslaFont/IndexEng.html)

The first one is seems handwritten. Very few script fonts match it's sharp aggressive character, i.e. angular, in a monoline connecting script. Of the fonts suggested so far, Måns Grebäck's Notera and Signerica [thanks Ryuk] are part way there. A few more partial matches to the character of the script are  
Roland Hörmann's Neo Noir Slim [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/phospho/neonoir-bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/phospho/neonoir-bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/phospho/neonoir-bold/")  
PT Script Barguzin [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/pt-script-barguzin/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/pt-script-barguzin/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/pt-script-barguzin/")  
Robert Slimbach's Caflisch Script [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/caflisch-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150110232729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/caflisch-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/caflisch-script/")  
Mistral is sufficiently aggressive but is much thicker with too much variation in height and angle, so I did not include it.  
Don
the neonoir is really close. i think it will be hard to get closer cause the origin is handwritten, like you said. Good Hint!!! :) Thanks! Baldur
